Image 11 of 11 Chronicle critics offer entertainment suggestions 1 / 11 Back to Gallery Buffalo Bayou Park: Stretching from Shepherd Drive to Sabine Street, the 160-acre Buffalo Bayou Park will celebrate its grand opening with a day of activities, including live music, walking tours, children's crafts, a beer garden and a food truck gathering. The event will culminate with a illuminated procession and a fireworks show.
When: 1:30-9:30 p.m. Saturday
Where: 105 Sabine
Information: buffalobayou.org
HE'S NOT LONELY: Kinky Friedman performs frequently in these parts, but this time through he has "The Loneliest Man I Ever Met," his first new album in four decades. On it he covers songs by Johnny Cash , Merle Haggard , Tom Waits , Warren Zevon and others as well as contributing some of his own, including the title track. 5:30 p.m. Friday at Cactus Music, 2110 Portsmouth; free with album purchase; 713-526-9272.
Andrew Dansby
a good MATCH: The long-awaited Midtown Arts and Theater Center Houston (MATCH) has a soft opening this week with performances. Uptown Dance Company's "Dance Infusion" features choreography by Krissy Richmond , Alex Pandiscio and Beth Gulledge-Brown at 7 p.m. Friday-Saturday ($15-$30). Apollo Chamber Players present "Rhapsody Nouveau," a diverse program inspired by Jewish folk music and American jazz that includes the premiere of Gilad Cohen 's "Three Goat Blues," at 6 p.m. Sunday ($10-$30); 3400 Main; 713-874-5875, matchouston.org .
Molly Glentzer
a New light: What could possibly be new about Claude Monet 's legendary water lilies? Ohio artist Mark Fox found an angle during his Monet Foundation residency in Giverny, France. His "Giverny: Journal of an Unseen Garden" takes viewers under the surface of the pond via a high-def video installation. It puts a beautiful 21st-century spin on the great Impressionist's practice of capturing the effects of shifting light from different seasons and different times of day on a single subject. The show debuts 10 a.m.-5 p.m. Saturday; through Nov. 28 at Hiram Butler Gallery, 4520 Blossom; 713-863-7097; hirambutler.com . FREE
Molly Glentzer
Buffalo Bayou Park: Stretching from Shepherd to Sabine, the 160-acre Buffalo Bayou Park will celebrate its grand opening with a day of activities, including live music, walking tours, children's crafts, a beer garden and a food truck gathering. The event will culminate with a illuminated procession and a fireworks show.
When: 1:30-9:30 p.m. Saturday
Where: 105 Sabine
Information: buffalobayou.org
Animated life: For more than 60 years, Gerard Baldwin has worked different facets of animation, from writing to directing to drawing cartoon characters, including Mr. Magoo, the Smurfs, the Flintstones, Bullwinkle and his pal Rocky, the Grinch and Yogi Bear. Born in New York, Baldwin has lived in Houston since 1989, where he continues creating and teaching art. The Emmy-winning artist has a new memoir, "From Mr. Magoo to Papa Smurf," about his life and career. Baldwin will sell some original artwork and sign copies of the book at 3 p.m. Saturday at Cactus Music, 2110 Portsmouth; free; 713-526-9272.
Andrew Dansby
Step back in time: The delightful trio Shannon and the Clams make music as though the members are locked in the mid-'60s. They incorporate elements of girl groups, doo-wop, garage rock and surf guitar into a joyous mix that can be heard on the new "Gone By the Dawn." 9 p.m. Sunday at Rudyard's, 2010 Waugh; $11-$13; 713-521-0521, rudyardspub.com .
Andrew Dansby
